hadiths.english_translation: Biographical entry: From the family of Dhi Yazan, Medinan, from his father, from his grandfather, described as munkir al-hadith (rejected in hadith). Also regarding Abd al-Rahman ibn Yahya ibn Abbad, Zayd ibn Habab reported from him

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ahmad ibn Isa: Abdullah ibn Wahb narrated to us, Ibn Abi Dhi'b informed us, from Husayn ibn Abdullah ibn Dumayra, from his father, from his grandfather, that the Prophet ﷺ passed by Umm Dumayra while she was weeping, saying: 'My son is being separated from me.' He said: 'Do not separate a mother from her child,' then he sent to the one who had Dumayra, called him, and bought him (the child) from him with a young camel.

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn Wahb
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Wahb ibn Muslim al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Ibn Abi Dhi'b
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Amr ibn Abi Dhi'b al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Husayn ibn Abdullah
narrators.full_name: Husayn ibn Abdullah ibn Dumayra (Sa'd al-Humayri)

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Multiple narrators in the chain (Husayn ibn Abdullah, Abdullah ibn Dumayra, and the unnamed grandfather) have unknown reliability status (majhul al-hal or majhul)
These unknown narrators represent breaks or weak points in the chain despite the strength of Ahmad ibn Isa, Abdullah ibn Wahb, and Ibn Abi Dhi'b

potential_issues.impact: Husayn ibn Abdullah and his father Abdullah ibn Dumayra are both majhul al-hal, and Dumayra's grandfather is entirely unknown (majhul). These weak links significantly compromise the chain despite the strength of the first three narrators
The chain goes through multiple generations of the same family (Dumayra's grandfather → his father → his grandson) with no established reliability documentation for any of them

potential_issues.issue: Weak middle narrators despite strong beginning and end
potential_issues.impact: While Ahmad ibn Isa and Abdullah ibn Wahb are reliable, and Ibn Abi Dhi'b is trustworthy, the middle section through completely unknown Dumayra family members weakens the entire transmission

potential_issues.issue: Use of عَنْ with unknown narrators
potential_issues.impact: The use of عَنْ (indirect transmission) with all three unknown narrators increases ambiguity about the actual nature of transmission

Topics: Incident of Umm Dumayra weeping over separation from her son
Prophet's ﷺ prohibition of separating mothers from children
Incident of the Prophet ﷺ purchasing the freedom of a child

hadiths.english_translation: Biographical account: Zayd ibn Habab said to me, Husayn ibn Waqid said: There was a trial (fitna) among us in Khorasan during the time of al-Karmani and Abi Muslim, I did not ask about it, nor did I ask until it passed. Ali ibn Husayn said: My father died in the year one hundred fifty-nine or one hundred fifty-seven.

narrators.name: Husayn ibn Waqid
narrators.full_name: Husayn ibn Waqid, Abu Ali, the judge of Marw

The text contains personal narrative and historical commentary rather than a transmitted statement or action from the Prophet ﷺ or companions
